extendedIngredients.name: brown sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup tightly packed dark brown sugar

extendedIngredients.name: green onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bunch green onions, white and tender green parts only, thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: hoisin sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: Steamed white rice and hoisin sauce, for serving

extendedIngredients.name: sriracha sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons sriracha sauce, plus more for serving

recipes.title: Max and Eli Sussman's Korean-Style Short Ribs
recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, 1 cup water, the vinegars, brown sugar, sriracha, and pepper. Add the yellow onion, green onions, and garlic and stir to blend well. Add the short ribs and turn to coat well with the marinade. Cover with plastic wrap and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 12 hours or, preferably, 24 hours.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Line a large, heavy-duty baking sheet with foil. Remove the ribs from the marinade and shake off the onions and garlic. Place on the prepared baking sheet and let come to room temperature (this could take up to an hour).                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Preheat the broiler. Broil the ribs until the surface of the meat begins to caramelize, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the broiler, turn, slide back under the broiler, and broil until cooked through, about 5 minutes longer. Remove from the broiler and serve right away with rice, hoisin sauce, and additional sriracha.

steps.step: In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, 1 cup water, the vinegars, brown sugar, sriracha, and pepper.
Add the yellow onion, green onions, and garlic and stir to blend well.
Add the short ribs and turn to coat well with the marinade. Cover with plastic wrap and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 12 hours or, preferably, 24 hours.
Line a large, heavy-duty baking sheet with foil.
Remove the ribs from the marinade and shake off the onions and garlic.
Place on the prepared baking sheet and let come to room temperature (this could take up to an hour).
Preheat the broiler. Broil the ribs until the surface of the meat begins to caramelize, 5 to 7 minutes.
Remove from the broiler, turn, slide back under the broiler, and broil until cooked through, about 5 minutes longer.
Remove from the broiler and serve right away with rice, hoisin sauce, and additional sriracha.
